smells.name: LabeledExpression
smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

instances.message: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface ILaunchLaneConfig is too complex. Consider splitting it up.
The interface ILaunchEntryConfig is too complex. Consider splitting it up.
The interface ITransactionContext is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function drawableToBitmap appears to be too complex.
The function getAppName appears to be too complex.
The function getAppIcon appears to be too complex.
The function onCreateView appears to be too complex.
The function loadData appears to be too complex.
The function addLaneView appears to be too complex.
The function animateNeutralZone appears to be too complex.
The function doInBackground appears to be too complex.
The function onCreate appears to be too complex.
The function doHandleTouch appears to be too complex.
The function showSelectionIndicator appears to be too complex.
The function onStartCommand appears to be too complex.
The function readFromJSON appears to be too complex.
The function handleDragScroll appears to be too complex.
The function onDrag appears to be too complex.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'TransactionContext' with '21' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Interface 'ITransactionContext' with '17' functions detected. Defined threshold inside interfaces is set to '11'
Class 'EditFolderFragment' with '15' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'LauncherView' with '22' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'IntentSelectorAdapter' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'LaunchLaneView' with '24' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'LauncherOverlayService' with '25' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'

smells.name: StringLiteralDuplication
smells.description: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

instances.message: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.
Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.
Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.
Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.
Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function getName is nested too deeply.
Function doInBackground is nested too deeply.
Function doHandleTouch is nested too deeply.
Function handleTouch is nested too deeply.

smells.name: LongMethod
smells.description: One method should have one responsibility. Long methods tend to handle many things at once. Prefer smaller methods to make them easier to understand.

instances.message: The function addActivationSettings is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function addAppearanceSettings is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function addNeutralZone is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function onCreate is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function createViews is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function showSelectionIndicator is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function applyParameters is too long. The maximum length is 20.
The function addActivationViewToWindow is too long. The maximum length is 20.

smells.name: LargeClass
smells.description: One class should have one responsibility. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. Split up large classes into smaller classes that are easier to understand.

instances.message: Class SettingsFragment is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class LauncherView is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class LaunchLaneView is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.
Class LauncherOverlayService is too large. Consider splitting it into smaller pieces.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function addActivationViewToWindow has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: EmptyCatchBlock
smells.description: Empty block of code detected. As they serve no purpose they should be removed.

This empty block of code can be removed.
This empty block of code can be removed.

smells.name: UnsafeCallOnNullableType

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: android.widget.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.widget.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.app.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
